intro: Albuca knersvlaktensis, commonly known as the Knysna albuca, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces tall, slender stems that bear clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is adapted to arid environments and requires well-drained soil. Albuca knersvlaktensis is often grown as an ornamental plant for its elegant appearance and drought tolerance.
